sentence.Network_en: The chopstick I poked your arm with is on the floor.
sentence.Network_cn: 直译:我戳你的那根筷子现在在地板上.

sentence.Network_en: A 20 - year old tree could produce 3000 - 4000 pairs of chopstick.
sentence.Network_cn: 一棵生长了20年的大树,仅能制成3000至4000双筷子.

sentence.Network_en: Wife: No ! I don't want it because your chopstick touch it.
sentence.Network_cn: 老婆: 你的脏筷子碰过的,谁吃!

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 17th cent.: pidgin English, from chop 'quick' + stick, translating Chinese dialect kuaìzi, literally 'nimble ones'. Compare with chop-chop

entry.def: Chopsticks are a pair of thin sticks which people in China and the Far East use to eat their food.

means.word_mean: 1. oriental tableware consisting of a pair of sticks used to eat food with
